label: First confirmed case
Government announces decree imposing quarantine of more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in Northern Italy
Nationwide shutdown of all schools and universities
Enacts forced quarantine (lockdown)  for region of Lombardy, nearly a quarter of its population (travel restrictions and ban on all public gatherings)
Extends emergency coronavirus measures to entire country and places all 60 million residents on lockdown (travel restrictions and ban on all public gatherings)
Reports 475 deaths, highest single-day death toll for any country since outbreak began
One of the earliest known coronavirus patients reports feeling ill
Wuhan health officials are told about the new coronavirus
Chinese officials inform WHO about cluster of 41 patients with mysterious pneumonia
Novel coronavirus identified
First death reported
Wuhan and three other cities placed under quarantine
Hubei province placed under quarantine; lockdown extended to cover 36 million people and new hospital in Wuhan begins to be built
WHO declares global public health emergency
Death toll surpasses that of 2002-2003 SARS epidemic with 811 deaths recorded
First US case confirmed in Snohomish County, Washington
Trump bans foreign nationals from entering the US if they were in China within the prior two weeks
First death reported
Trump bans all travel from 26 European countries
US national emergency is declared
Nearly all US states declare state of emergency
Santa Clara County declares state of emergency
San Francisco declares city emergency
First death in California reported
California declares state emergency
California recommends canceling gatherings over 250 people (not mandated)
California announces all bars and wineries are to close
California orders “shelter-in-place” mandate
New York declares state of emergency
New York bans gatherings of more than 500 people
First death in New York reported
New York orders mandate akin to “shelter-in-place”
Texas declares state of emergency
First death in Texas reported
First US case confirmed in Snohomish County, Washington
First death in Washington reported
